meanings.definition: The part of the cerebral cortex concerned with sight and hearing in mammals, regarded as the most recently evolved part of the cortex.
meanings.sent1: The neocortex helps mammals see and hear things around them.
meanings.sent2: The neocortex is crucial for processing visual and auditory information in mammals.
meanings.sent3: The neocortex must be working overtime when a cat tries to catch a laser pointer's dot.
meanings.sent4: Her neocortex was like a high-tech command center, processing all the sounds and sights of the city.
meanings.sent5: The neocortex, like a vigilant sentinel, never misses a detail in the environment.
